title: Tobias
text:
Tobias is the <a href="transliteration">transliteration</a> of the <a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a> ("") which is a translation of the <a href="Hebrew">Hebrew</a> biblical name "Toviyah" (<a href="Hebrew%20language">Hebrew</a>: טוֹבִיה), meaning ""<a href="Jah">Yah</a> is good"". With the biblical <a href="Book%20of%20Tobias">Book of Tobias</a> being present in the <a href="Deuterocanon">Deuterocanon</a>/<a href="Biblical%20apocrypha">Apocrypha</a> of the <a href="Bible">Bible</a>, Tobias is a popular male <a href="given%20name">given name</a> for both Christians and Jews in <a href="English%20language">English-speaking countries</a>, <a href="German%20language">German-speaking countries</a>, the <a href="Low%20Countries">Low Countries</a>, and <a href="Scandinavia">Scandinavia</a>n countries. In English-speaking countries, it is often shortened to <a href="Toby">Toby</a>. In German, this name appears as Tobias or Tobi; in French as Tobie; and in Swedish as Tobias or Tobbe. Tobias has also been a surname.
Biblical.
Several people are called Tobias or similar names in <a href="the%20Bible">the Bible</a> era:
